info.title: Canopy Servicing Core API
info.description:
**API Overview** 
 Canopy allows you to easily manage credit, installment, or other more complex lending programs from a servicing and compliance perspective - whether newly launched or migrated from existing systems. Using Canopy, you can track balances and transactions for each customer of your product, both in real-time and historically. You can see how various policy and product changes would impact your customers, and readily generate compliance reports and minimize your risk with all real-time information always on hand. 
 
 Canopy additionally surfaces information around all of your lending activity through its intuitive UI which provides a customer support interface as well as at-a-glance data needed for compliance and insights. 
 
 Simply configure your productâ€™s policies through our Create Product API endpoint, and then you can immediately begin adding customer accounts and relying on Canopy for accurate servicing information.

x-topics.title: Getting Started
x-topics.content:
*Get started in three easy steps.* 
 
 1) Review the [Authentication](https://learn.canopyservicing.com/dev-setup) tutorial to connect and experiment with our Sandbox environment. 
 
 2) Create your own credentials in our [public sandbox](https://play.canopyservicing.com/register). 
 
 3) Follow the onboarding steps once you've logged into the public sandbox. 
 
 Once your product is configured and launched in Canopy, you have access to the full power of the Servicing API! You can take advantage of sample workflows provided by our team, or construct your own using this API documentation.

x-topics.title: Authentication
x-topics.content: To create your organization within Canopy, register for our [public sandbox](https://play.canopyservicing.com/register). You can find a full guide to authenticating in Canopy in our [developer onboarding tutorial](https://learn.canopyservicing.com/dev-setup).

x-topics.title: Troubleshooting
x-topics.content: See a [detailed overview of error codes supported by Canopy and their meanings.](https://www.notion.so/canopy1/External-API-Status-Codes-576e6b9e43154db286d39a9aba1391aa)

x-topics.title: Test it out
x-topics.content:
To get going quickly, we recommend using an API collaboration tool called Postman. You can use the buttons below to import our collection, which points to the environment you want to build against and already has our API endpoints configured. Be sure to define the required environment variables. 
 
 If you'd just like to get set up with Canopy and send some requests with pre-populated sample data, we recommend using our Quickstart collection. 
 
 When you'd like to start applying some business logic and try formulating what your actual implementation looks like, we recommend starting with our public sandbox. 
 
 Once you've explored our public sandbox and formulated your business model, you can test in our protected UAT environment. 
 
**Quickstart:** [![Quickstart](https://run.pstmn.io/button.svg)](https:/carpp.getpostman.com/run-collection/5c939be57d1af0629496#?env%5BPLAY%) 

**Public Sandbox:** [![Public Sandbox](https://run.pstmn.io/button.svg)](https://app.getpostman.com/run-collection/d0b9c971e4ab3bb1324f#?env%5BProtected%3A%20Public%20Sandbox%) 
 
**Protected UAT:** [![Protected UAT](https://run.pstmn.io/button.svg)](https://app.getpostman.com/run-collection/d0b9c971e4ab3bb1324f#?env%5BProtected%3A%20Public%20UAT%) 
 
**Production:** [![Run in Postman](https://run.pstmn.io/button.svg)](https://app.getpostman.com/run-collection/d0b9c971e4ab3bb1324f#?env%5BProtected%3A%20Production%)

x-topics.title: Pagination
x-topics.content: Canopy uses a two-factor basis to drive the order of responses in `GET` requests with an array of results. They are first ordered by `effective_at` by when the entity is effective in the system, and second by an internal index to make sure the order is always universal. From the caller's perspective, you can let Canopy know where to start its pagination response by providing a `starting_after` or `ending_before` string value. If neither a `starting_after` nor `ending_before` value is provided, we'll assume you're requesting the very first page of responses. In subsequent requests, you can simply grab these values from the `paging` key in the response body from your previous request. If you're aiming to provide your users with a link to the previous page, use the `ending_before` query parameter in your next request. If going to the next page, use the `starting_after` value instead.

post.summary: Invite a new API user to Canopy
post.description: When you create a new API user via this `POST` request, an email invite will be sent for the new user to join your organization. The email invite includes a link with a unique token that will allow the new user to register to join your team in Canopy.

requestBody.description: Body of request to invite new API user. Checks permissions of invite-creator.

post.description:
At its core, Canopy allows you to create credit products that meet the specific needs of your users. We offer robust options to configure these products within our system. 
 
 For most use cases, we recommend configuring products by sending an excel file detailing your preferred configurations to the [Canopy team](mailto:support@canopyservicing.com?subject=API%20Access%20Request); however, you can also configure and manage products programmatically using this API documentation. 
 
 Request body for creating a new product.

effective_at.description: The `Date-Time` as of which this product is effective on the server.

external_product_id.description: A unique external ID that may be used interchangeably with the Canopy-generated product ID

product_overview.description: A series of static fields about the product.

product_name.description: Name of Product, i.e. BNPL 24 Month Standard.

product_short_description.description: A short description of the product ranging from 0 - 60 characters.

product_long_description.description: Description of the Product ranging from 0 - 1000.

product_color.description: A color to be associated with the product for UI purposes.

delinquent_on_n_consecutive_late_fees.description: After this number of consecutive late events, the account status shifts to `suspended` with a status subtype of `delinquent`

charge_off_on_n_consecutive_late_fees.description: After this number of consecutive late events, the account status shifts to `suspended` with a status subtype of `charged_off`

payment_due_policies.description: The set of policies governing payment due information for the product.

late_fee_grace.description: Defaults to 0 days. The amount of time after a payment is late after which you would like for a late fee to be incurred.

surcharge_fee_interval.description: The interval at which a surcharge fee is assessed.

default_surcharge_fee_structure.description: The transaction volume structure that dictates a transaction fee.

surcharge_start_inclusive_cents.description: Indicates the starting transaction volume at which this fee will apply.

surcharge_end_exclusive_cents.description: Indicates the ending transaction volume at which this fee will apply. If not provided, the surcharge will apply to any transaction volume above the defined start.

percent_surcharge.description: Indicates the surcharge fee as a percent of total transaction volume that will be applied to the account if the total transaction volume during the surcharge interval falls within the provided start and end range.

fee_policies.description: The set of policies governing fees for the product.

cycle_interval.description: The length of the billing cycle. after which a statement is generated, and a due date assigned. IE '1 month' '3 months' or '7 days' (most common is monthly)

cycle_due_interval.description: Defaults to 0 days. The amount of time before statement cut that the payment should be due for the billing cycle. If positive, it will count days from the start of the cycle. Note, this field has a signage convention: if negative, it will count days back from the end of the cycle. IE '25 days' indicates that payments are due 25 days after the statement is cut. `-5` days indicates that payments will be due five days prior to the cut of the *next* cycle. Cannot exceed the duration of the billing cycle.

first_cycle_interval.description: Defaults to 0 days. If applicable, the amount of time you would like between origination and the first statement cut. IE '10 days'. If you would like the first billing cycle to be the same length as all other billing cycles, either do not include this field in the request, or set its value to the same as `billing_cycle_period`

close_of_business_time.description: Defaults to EST Midnight. Time of the close of business. Note* this value will be converted into the `product_time_zone` This is used for statement cuts and partner-level and issuing bank-level reconciliation

product_time_zone.description: Timezone denoted as an Olson-style timezone defining the timezone for the product. All times in any response data for accounts using this product will be denominated in this timezone. Shifts due to daylight savings will be accounted for where relevant, and all output timestamps will be denoted as UTC offsets normalized based on this value. Defaults to America/New_York if not provided.

billing_cycle_policies.description: The set of policies governing the billing cycle for the product.

interest_calc_time.description: Defaults to EST 1AM. Interest for this policy is calculated at this time every X interval.

default_credit_limit_cents.description: The default maximum principal credit (in cents) available for a customer account. For risk-based-pricing, this default limit can be overridden on a per-account basis if a `credit_limit` is selected at the time of assigning an account to a product in the `Create Account` call. Credit limits for an account can also be updated post-account creation.

default_late_fee_cents.description: The default late fee for accounts enrolled in this product. This will be used if no late fee is provided at account creation.

default_payment_reversal_fee_cents.description: The default payment reversa fee for accounts enrolled in this product. This will be used if no late fee is provided at account creation.

promotional_policies.description: If applicable, a promotional configuration for the product.

promo_len.description: Defaults to 0. The number of billing cycles from account origination during which accounts on this product are on a promotional period.

promo_min_pay_type.description: Current due calculation method for the promotional period.

promo_purchase_window_len.description: If applicable, the number of billing cycles from account origination under which this product falls under a purchas window period.

promo_interest_deferred.description: Indicates whether interest accrued during the promotional period is deferred interest.

promo_default_interest_rate_percent.description: The rate that serves as the active interest rate for accounts during the promotional period.

promo_min_pay_percent.description: Defaults to 100. The percent of new interest in the cycle used to determine the minimum payment.

promo_apr_range_inclusive_lower.description: Optional lower bound for APR Range for the product (i.e. 2 = 2%).

promo_apr_range_inclusive_upper.description: Optional upper bound for APR Range for the product (i.e. 5 = 5%).

post_promo_len.description: Default duration for any amortization period during post-promotion

post_promo_am_len_range_inclusive_lower.description: Optional lower bound for amortization length in billing cycles for the product.

post_promo_am_len_range_inclusive_upper.description: Optional upper bound for amortization length in billing cycles for the product.

post_promo_min_pay_type.description: Current due calculation method for the post-promotional period.

post_promo_default_interest_rate_percent.description: The rate that serves as the active interest rate for accounts during the post-promotional period.

post_promo_apr_range_inclusive_lower.description: Optional lower bound for APR Range for the product (i.e. 2 = 2%).

post_promo_apr_range_inclusive_upper.description: Optional upper bound for APR Range for the product (i.e. 5 = 5%).

migration_mode.description: If migration mode is on, Canopy will stop auto-generating statements for this account.

product_id.description: The Canopy-generated ID for the product.

created_at.description: The `Date-Time` that this product was created on the server.

effective_at.description: The `Date-Time` as of which this product is effective on the server.

get.description: If you have configured and launched multiple products within Canopy, retrieve information related to all of your configured products at once.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of products to be returned. Defaults to 10.

parameters.name: starting_after
parameters.description: Pass the value from the `paging` response body in your previous request. If not provided, the zero-indexed starting point will be used. Either starting_after or ending_before may be provided, but not both.

parameters.name: ending_before
parameters.description: Pass the value from the `paging` response body in your previous request. If not provided, the zero-indexed starting point will be used. Either starting_after or ending_before may be provided, but not both.

results.description: An array of information for all products within the requested range.

put.description:
At its core, Canopy allows you to create credit products that meet the specific needs of your users. We offer robust options to configure these products within our system. 
 
 For most use cases, we recommend configuring products by sending an excel file detailing your preferred configurations to the [Canopy team](mailto:support@canopyservicing.com?subject=API%20Access%20Request); however, you can also configure and manage products programmatically using this API documentation. 
 
 Request body for creating a new product.

requestBody.description: Update admin panel for a product.

migration_mode.description: If migration mode is on, Canopy will not autogenerate statements for this account.

get.summary: Get all accounts for all customers
get.description: Returns all accounts from the perspective of each customer. For instance, if one account has two customers, these are reflected as two separate items in the response array. Similarly, if one customer has multiple accounts, each account is reflected as a separate item in the response array.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of customer accounts to be returned. Defaults to 30.

parameters.name: starting_after
parameters.description: Pass the value from the `paging` response body in your previous request. If not provided, the zero-indexed starting point will be used. Either starting_after or ending_before may be provided, but not both.

parameters.name: ending_before
parameters.description: Pass the value from the `paging` response body in your previous request. If not provided, the zero-indexed starting point will be used. Either starting_after or ending_before may be provided, but not both.

parameters.name: search_parameters
parameters.description: Currently, this API only supports searching by `name_first` or `name_last`. Based on the input search parameter, the top responses from our API search, up to or less than the provided `limit` will be returned.

cycle_exclusive_end.description: The inclusive ending `Date-Time` that defines which transactions are part of this statement.

cycle_interval.description: The length of the billing cycle. after which a statement is generated, and a due date assigned. IE '1 month' '3 months' or '7 days' (most common is monthly)

cycle_due_interval.description: Defaults to 0 days. The amount of time before statement cut that the payment should be due for the billing cycle. If positive, it will count days from the start of the cycle. Note, this field has a signage convention: if negative, it will count days back from the end of the cycle. IE '25 days' indicates that payments are due 25 days after the statement is cut. `-5` days indicates that payments will be due five days prior to the cut of the *next* cycle. Cannot exceed the duration of the billing cycle.

first_cycle_interval.description: Defaults to 0 days. If applicable, the amount of time you would like between origination and the first statement cut. IE '10 days'. If you would like the first billing cycle to be the same length as all other billing cycles, either do not include this field in the request, or set its value to the same as `billing_cycle_period`

close_of_business_time.description: Defaults to EST Midnight. Time of the close of business. Note* this value will be converted into the `product_time_zone` This is used for statement cuts and partner-level and issuing bank-level reconciliation

product_time_zone.description: Timezone denoted as an Olson-style timezone defining the timezone for the product. All times in any response data for accounts using this product will be denominated in this timezone. Shifts due to daylight savings will be accounted for where relevant, and all output timestamps will be denoted as UTC offsets normalized based on this value. Defaults to America/New_York if not provided.

product_id.description: The Canopy-generated ID for the product.

created_at.description: The `Date-Time` that this product was created on the server.

effective_at.description: The `Date-Time` as of which this product is effective on the server.

external_product_id.description: A unique external ID that may be used interchangeably with the Canopy-generated product ID

product_overview.description: A series of static fields about the product.

product_name.description: Name of Product, i.e. Express Card.

product_short_description.description: A short description of the product ranging from 0 - 60 characters.

product_long_description.description: Description of the Product ranging from 0 - 1000.

product_color.description: A color to be associated with the product for UI purposes.

delinquent_on_n_consecutive_late_fees.description: After this number of consecutive late events, the account status shifts to `suspended` with a status subtype of `delinquent`

charge_off_on_n_consecutive_late_fees.description: After this number of consecutive late events, the account status shifts to `suspended` with a status subtype of `charged_off`

payment_due_policies.description: The set of policies governing payment due information for the product.

late_fee_grace.description: Defaults to 0 days. The amount of time after a payment is late after which you would like for a late fee to be incurred.

surcharge_fee_interval.description: The interval at which a surcharge fee is assessed.

default_surcharge_fee_structure.description: The transaction volume structure that dictates a transaction fee.

surcharge_start_inclusive_cents.description: Indicates the starting transaction volume at which this fee will apply.

surcharge_end_exclusive_cents.description: Indicates the ending transaction volume at which this fee will apply. If not provided, the surcharge will apply to any transaction volume above the defined start.

percent_surcharge.description: Indicates the surcharge fee as a percent of total transaction volume that will be applied to the account if the total transaction volume during the surcharge interval falls within the provided start and end range.

fee_policies.description: The set of policies governing fees for the product.

cycle_interval.description: The length of the billing cycle. after which a statement is generated, and a due date assigned. IE '1 month' '3 months' or '7 days' (most common is monthly)

cycle_due_interval.description: Defaults to 0 days. The amount of time before statement cut that the payment should be due for the billing cycle. If positive, it will count days from the start of the cycle. Note, this field has a signage convention: if negative, it will count days back from the end of the cycle. IE '25 days' indicates that payments are due 25 days after the statement is cut. `-5` days indicates that payments will be due five days prior to the cut of the *next* cycle. Cannot exceed the duration of the billing cycle.

first_cycle_interval.description: Defaults to 0 days. If applicable, the amount of time you would like between origination and the first statement cut. IE '10 days'. If you would like the first billing cycle to be the same length as all other billing cycles, either do not include this field in the request, or set its value to the same as `billing_cycle_period`

close_of_business_time.description: Defaults to EST Midnight. Time of the close of business. Note* this value will be converted into the `product_time_zone` This is used for statement cuts and partner-level and issuing bank-level reconciliation

product_time_zone.description: Timezone denoted as an Olson-style timezone defining the timezone for the product. All times in any response data for accounts using this product will be denominated in this timezone. Shifts due to daylight savings will be accounted for where relevant, and all output timestamps will be denoted as UTC offsets normalized based on this value. Defaults to America/New_York if not provided.

billing_cycle_policies.description: The set of policies governing the billing cycle for the product.

interest_calc_time.description: Defaults to EST 1AM. Interest for this policy is calculated at this time every X interval.

default_credit_limit_cents.description: The default maximum principal credit (in cents) available for a customer account. This default limit can be overridden on a per-account basis if a `credit_limit` is selected at the time of assigning an account to a product. Credit limits for an account can also be updated post-account creation.

default_late_fee_cents.description: The default maximum principal credit (in cents) available for a customer account. This default limit can be overridden on a per-account basis if a `credit_limit` is selected at the time of assigning an account to a product. Credit limits for an account can also be updated post-account creation.

default_payment_reversal_fee_cents.description: The default maximum principal credit (in cents) available for a customer account. This default limit can be overridden on a per-account basis if a `credit_limit` is selected at the time of assigning an account to a product. Credit limits for an account can also be updated post-account creation.

promotional_policies.description: If applicable, a promotional configuration for the product.

promo_len.description: The number of billing cycles from account origination during which accounts on this product are on a promotional period.

promo_min_pay_type.description: Current due calculation method for the promotional period.

promo_purchase_window_len.description: If applicable, the number of billing cycles from account origination under which this product falls under a purchas window period.

promo_min_pay_percent.description: Defaults to 100. The percent of new interest in the cycle used to determine the minimum payment.

promo_interest_deferred.description: Indicates whether interest accrued during the promotional period is deferred interest.

promo_default_interest_rate_percent.description: The rate that serves as the active interest rate for accounts during the promotional period.

promo_apr_range_inclusive_lower.description: Optional lower bound for APR Range for the product (i.e. 2 = 2%).

promo_apr_range_inclusive_upper.description: Optional upper bound for APR Range for the product (i.e. 5 = 5%).

post_promo_len.description: Default duration for the amortization period during post-promotion

post_promo_am_len_range_inclusive_lower.description: Optional lower bound for amortization length in billing cycles for the product.

post_promo_am_len_range_inclusive_upper.description: Optional upper bound for amortization length in billing cycles for the product.

post_promo_min_pay_type.description: Current due calculation method for the post-promotional period.

post_promo_default_interest_rate_percent.description: The rate that serves as the active interest rate for accounts during the post-promotional period.

post_promo_apr_range_inclusive_lower.description: Optional lower bound for APR Range for the product (i.e. 2 = 2%).

post_promo_apr_range_inclusive_upper.description: Optional upper bound for APR Range for the product (i.e. 5 = 5%).

account_count_total.description: Total number of accounts under the product.

migration_mode.description: If migration mode is on, Canopy will stop auto-generating statements for this account.

CustomerAccounts.description: Array of Customers and their corresponding Accounts

results.description: An array of information for all customer-account correspondences within the requested range.

customer_id.description: A Canopy-generated ID for the customer.

name_prefix.description: Prefix to the customer's name. Primary account holder or controlling officer name for Business customers.

name_first.description: Customer's first name. Primary account holder or controlling officer name for Business customers.

name_middle.description: Customer's middle name. Primary account holder or controlling officer name for Business customers.

name_last.description: Customer's last name. Primary account holder or controlling officer name for Business customers.

phone_number.description: Customer's phone number in E.164 format

address_zip.description: Five digit zipcode or nine digit 'ZIP+4'

ssn.description: Social security number of the customer

email.description: The email address of this Customer

date_of_birth.description: Customer's date of birth in ISO 8601 format

business_legal_name.description: The legal name of the Business

doing_business_as.description: The DBA name of the Business

customer_account_role.description: The role of the customer for the account.

customer_account_external_id.description: A unique number for the customer on the account. For instance, a credit card number. If none is provided, a Canopy-generated ID can be used.

last_four.description: Last four digits of the card number

memo.description: Friendly name to identify the card

type.description: The type of card created by Lithic

account_id.description: This is generated by Canopy. A unique ID for the account.

created_at.description: The `Date-Time` which the account was created in the API.

effective_at.description: The `Date-Time` that this account became/becomes active.

external_account_id.description: Note: The value passed here *must* be unique. This ties to a reference of your account in an external system. For example, you may have a ten digit loan number you use to reference the account.

account_status.description: The Status of the Account. Active upon account creation.

account_status_subtype.description: The subtype of the Status of the Account. Null upon account creation.

account_product.description: The product associated with the account.

product_id.description: The Canopy-generated ID for the product.

external_product_id.description: A unique external ID that may be used interchangeably with the Canopy-generated product ID

product_name.description: Name of Product, i.e. Express Card.

product_color.description: A color to be associated with the product for UI purposes.

product_short_description.description: Short description of the Product - max of 30 characters.

product_time_zone.description: Timezone denoted as an [Olson-style timezone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones) defining the timezone for the product. All times in any response data for accounts using this product will be denominated in this timezone. Shifts due to daylight savings will be accounted for where relevant, and all output timestamps will be denoted as UTC offsets normalized based on this value.

product_type.description: The Type of Product. If not included, defaults to `REVOLVING`

late_fee_impl_cents.description: The fee charged for late payments on the account.

payment_reversal_fee_impl_cents.description: The fee charged for payment reversals on the account.

origination_fee_impl_cents.description: The fee charged at the time of account origination

annual_fee_impl_cents.description: An annual fee to be charged yearly from the date of account creation. It will reflect on the subsequent statement once incurred.

monthly_fee_impl_cents.description: A monthly fee to be charged monthly from the date of account creation. It will reflect on the subsequent statement once incurred.

loan_end_date.description: If applicable, the account's loan repayment date.

promo_purchase_window_inclusive_start.description: If applicable, the start date for a purchase window for the account

promo_purchase_window_exclusive_end.description: If applicable, the end date for a purchase window for the account

promo_inclusive_start.description: If applicable, the start date for a promotional period for the account.

promo_exclusive_end.description: If applicable, the start date for a promotional period for the account.

promo_impl_interest_rate_percent.description: The percentage interest applied to the account during the promotional period (i.e. 6.2%)

promo_len.description: Defaults to 0. The number of billing cycles from account origination during which accounts on this product are on a promotional period.

post_promo_inclusive_start.description: If applicable, the start date for a promotional period for the account.

post_promo_exclusive_end.description: If applicable, the start date for a promotional period for the account.

post_promo_impl_interest_rate_percent.description: The percentage interest applied to the account during the post-promotional period (i.e. 6.2%)

post_promo_len.description: If applicable, post-promotional amortization length in cycles.

promo_len.description: The number of billing cycles from account origination during which accounts on this product are on a promotional period.

promo_purchase_window_len.description: If applicable, the number of billing cycles from account origination under which this product falls under a purchas window period.

external_fields.description: An Array of External Fields. These should be used to connect accounts created in Canopy to Users in your system and any connected external systems.

key.description: key: i.e. Name of the External Party

statement_min_pay_cents.description: Total amount due for the billing cycle, summing cycle principal, interest, deferred interest, and fees outstanding.

min_pay_due_at.description: The `Date-Time` the payment for this billing cycle is due.

statement_min_pay_charges_principal_cent.description: Total principal due for the billing cycle.

statement_min_pay_interest_cents.description: Total interest due for the billing cycle.

statement_min_pay_am_interest_cents.description: The current AM interest balance of the line item. Canopy tracks interest during an amortization period separately from deferred interest accrued during a revolving period.

statement_min_pay_deferred_cents.description: Total deferred interest due for the billing cycle.

statement_min_pay_am_deferred_interest_c.description: The current AM deferred interest balance of the line item. Canopy tracks deferred interest during an amortization period separately from deferred interest accrued during a revolving period.

statement_min_pay_fees_cents.description: Total fees due for the billing cycle.

previous_statement_min_pay_cents.description: Previous amounts due, including fees. This is a subset of statement_min_pay_cents.

payment_processor_name.description: Indicates the active payment processor whose configuration will be used for payments made from the account. If `NONE`, Canopy will not trigger payments to an external payment processor when they occur.

autopay_enabled.description: Indicates whether autopay is enabled for this account. Currently, autopay is triggered 1 day prior to a payment due date.

valid_config.description: Indicates whether Canopy has a valid configuration stored for this payment processor for this account. For example, if Canopy needs an ACH token on behalf of the account to call the processor, this field will indicate that Canopy has successfully stored the necessary token.

account_token.description: The external unique identifier of the Lithic account against which charges are made.

first_cycle_interval.description: Interval for a first cycle for this account.

loan_discount_amount.description: Interval for a first cycle for this account.

loan_discount_at.description: Interval for a first cycle for this account.

total_balance_cents.description: The total balance (in cents) associated with the account.

principal_cents.description: The total balance (in cents) associated with the account.

interest_balance_cents.description: The total interest balance (in cents) associated with the account.

am_interest_balance_cents.description: The total AM interest balance (in cents) associated with the account.

deferred_interest_balance_cents.description: The total deferred interest balance (in cents) associated with the account.

am_deferred_interest_balance_cents.description: The total AM deferred interest balance (in cents) associated with the account.

total_paid_to_date_cents.description: The total sum of payments made to date (in cents) associated with the account.

total_interest_paid_to_date_cents.description: The total sum of interest allocations for payments made to date (in cents) associated with the account.

credit_limit_cents.description: Total Amount (in cents) that this account can borrow.

max_approved_credit_limit_cents.description: Total Amount (in cents) that this account can borrow.

interest_rate_percent.description: The percentage interest applied to the account (i.e. 6.2 means 6.2%)

available_credit_cents.description: The total available credit balance (in cents) for the account.

open_to_buy_cents.description: If applicable, the total amount of available funds for continued purchase following a purchase window pattern, where payments made do not replenish amount available for purchase.

schema.description: Statement for an account for a given billing cycle

account_id.description: The Canopy-generated ID for the account

statement_id.description: The Canopy-generated ID for the statement

promo_purchase_window_inclusive_start.description: If applicable, the `Date-Time` the purchase window for the account ends.

promo_purchase_window_exclusive_end.description: If applicable, the `Date-Time` the purchase window for the account ends.

promo_inclusive_start.description: If applicable, the `Date-Time` the promo period for the account starts.

promo_exclusive_end.description: If applicable, the `Date-Time` the promo period for the account ends.

open_to_buy_cents.description: If applicable, the total amount of available funds for continued purchase following a purchase window pattern, where payments made do not replenish amount available for purchase.

cycle_inclusive_start.description: The inclusive starting `Date-Time` that defines which transactions are part of this statement.

cycle_exclusive_end.description: The inclusive ending `Date-Time` that defines which transactions are part of this statement.

cycle_charges_cents.description: Sum of all charges that occurred on the account during the billing cycle.

cycle_loans_cents.description: Sum of all loans amounts that were initiated on the account during the billing cycle.

cycle_charge_returns_cents.description: Sum of all returns that occurred on the account during the billing cycle.

cycle_payments_cents.description: Sum of all payments that occurred on the account during the billing cycle.

cycle_payment_reversals_cents.description: Sum of all payment reversal amounts that occurred on the account during the billing cycle.

cycle_debit_adjustments_cents.description: Sum of all debit adjustment amounts that occurred on the account during the billing cycle.

cycle_credit_adjustments_cents.description: Sum of all credit adjustment amounts that occurred on the account during the billing cycle.

cycle_interest_cents.description: Total interest accrued during the billing cycle.

cycle_am_interest_cents.description: The current AM interest balance of the line item. Canopy tracks interest during an amortization period separately from deferred interest accrued during a revolving period.

cycle_deferred_interest_cents.description: Total interest accrued during the billing cycle.

cycle_am_deferred_interest_cents.description: Total interest accrued during the billing cycle. Canopy tracks deferred interest during an amortization period separately from deferred interest accrued during a revolving period.

cycle_late_fees_cents.description: Total late fees incurred during the billing cycle.

cycle_payment_reversals_fees_cents.description: Total payment reversal fees incurred during the billing cycle.

cycle_waived_deferred_interest_cents.description: Total deferred interest that was forgiven on the account during the billing cycle.

min_pay_cents.description: Total amount due for the billing cycle, summing cycle principal, interest, deferred interest, and fees outstanding.

min_pay_due_at.description: The `Date-Time` the payment for this billing cycle is due.

min_pay_charges_principal_cents.description: Total principal due for the billing cycle.

min_pay_interest_cents.description: Total interest due for the billing cycle.

min_pay_am_interest_cents.description: Total am interest due for the billing cycle.

min_pay_deferred_cents.description: Total deferred interest due for the billing cycle.

min_pay_am_deferred_interest_cents.description: The current AM deferred interest balance of the line item. Canopy tracks deferred interest during an amortization period separately from deferred interest accrued during a revolving period.

min_pay_fees_cents.description: Total fees due for the billing cycle.

previous_min_pay_cents.description: Previous amounts due, including fees. This is a subset of min_pay_cents.
